alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 4:24PM MDT until August 14 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Kane County in southern Utah...Specifically the Kanab area... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 424 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Kanab and the normally dry washes on the periphery of town. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, and streets. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kanab. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 59 and 67. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
